alert.note: Alert for Teller (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 10 at 2:52PM MDT until May 10 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Teller County in central Colorado... * Until 330 PM MDT. * At 252 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Westcreek, or 29 miles northwest of Colorado Springs, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Teller County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
